objective: Understand and identify the structural components of music.
content: Pitch, rhythm, dynamics, timbre, and texture. Exploring musical genres and styles.
specific_objectives: Identify musical elements: Rhythm (meter, tempo), Pitch (melody, harmony), Dynamics
Differentiate between various musical textures (monophony, homophony, polyphony)
Recognize the timbres of different instruments and voices
Identify diverse musical genres: Caribbean (Calypso, Reggae, Steelpan), Western Classical, Jazz, Pop
Describe the structure and form of musical pieces (Binary, Ternary, Rondo)

objective: Read and write musical notation accurately.
content: Staff notation, scales, intervals, and chords. Understanding time signatures and key signatures.
specific_objectives: Read and write in Treble and Bass clefs
Identify and construct major and minor scales (up to 4 sharps/flats)
Determine intervals and build triads
Recognize and use standard time signatures (simple and compound)
Translate rhythmic patterns into notation

objective: Develop skills in solo and ensemble performance.
content: Technique, expression, and stage presence. Preparing for practical assessments.
specific_objectives: Demonstrate technical proficiency on a primary instrument or voice
Perform with appropriate expression, phrasing, and dynamics
Collaborate effectively in an ensemble setting
Apply performance etiquette and stage presence
Critically evaluate own performance and that of others

objective: Create original musical works following specific guidelines.
content: Melodic and rhythmic development, arranging, and the use of technology in composition.
specific_objectives: Compose short melodic and rhythmic motifs
Develop motifs into complete musical phrases
Arrange existing pieces for different instrumental/vocal combinations
Utilize music notation software or digital audio workstations (DAWs) for composition
Reflect on and refine original compositions based on feedback
